oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Names
World War, 1939-1945 -- Europe; Prisoners of war; Diaries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These final pages include contact information for four individuals, A. J. Jankura of Cleveland, Ohio; Joe L. Ogan of Tulsa, Oklahoma; Billy Jo [Trice] of Dallas, Texas; and C. Elmer Hicks from Louisville, Kentucky. He has also written, "Ask Olaf about Mar. 13, 1945" on this page.

Hardy A. Mitchener, Jr. was shot down and captured as a POW during World War II after a bombing mission in Germany. He was sent to Stalag Luft III in Sagan, Germany. Stalag Luft III was originally opened in 1942 as a camp for RAF airmen. Later, by 1944, many of the prisoners were American fliers. About 10,000 men were imprisoned by late 1944. Mitchener obtained contact information for some of his fellow prisoners and other men that he met during the war. He put these notes in the back of his diary.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mitchener, Hardy A., 1919-1957
